Key Match Events: Trey Sweeney had four hits, including a home run
Ty Madden struck out seven and took a no-hit bid into the fifth
Lawrence Butler’s fifth-inning single was the A’s first hit
Zack Gelof drove in Oakland’s lone run with a sixth inning single
Sweeney singled home Spencer Torkelson in the fourth
Detroit tacked on six runs in the eighth charged to Ross Stripling
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch praised Madden’s performance and his ability to handle pressure
A.J. Hinch expressed pride in the team’s resilience after the come-from-behind win
A.J. Hinch called his final moments managing at the Coliseum bittersweet
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers are two games above.500 after taking two out of three in Oakland
The A’s have six games remaining at the Coliseum
The A’s will play their home games in Sacramento next season ahead of a planned move to Las Vegas in 2028
